'''Aaron Cohen''' (born 28 February 1976) is an [[Israelis|Israeli]]-[[United States|American]] [[writer]], [[Film director|director]], [[actor]], [[author]] and former [[Duvdevan Unit|Duvdevan]] [[Special Forces]] operator specializing in [[counter-terrorism]] and best known for his international bestselling memoir ''[[Brotherhood of Warriors]]''.<ref>http://www.amazon.com/Brotherhood-Warriors-Behind-Commando-Counterterrorism/dp/0061236160/ref=tmm_pap_title_0</ref>
== Early life and Israeli special-forces== Cohen was born to a [[Canadian Jews|Jewish]] family in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]].<ref name=Brotherhood>[https://www.harpercollins.com/web-sampler/9780061859762 ''Brotherhood of Warriors''] By Aaron Cohen and Douglas Century</ref> His parents divorced when he was young and the family moved to Miami where his mother believed she could advance her career as a screenwriter and producer.<ref name=Brotherhood /> She remarried to film producer [[Abby Mann]], and moved Aaron and his sister to [[Beverly Hills]].<ref name=Brotherhood /> Although raised in a non-religious household, he pressured his mother to let him get a bar mitzvah and moved to Montreal with his natural father for a year; and then spent the next several years shuttling between California, Canada, and Florida.<ref name=Brotherhood /> He attended [[Robert Land Academy]], a military academy in Canada, for high school.<ref name=Brotherhood /> After high school, Cohen left Los Angeles for Israel, working on a [[kibbutz]] before enlisting in the [[Israel Defense Forces]]. After a grueling tryout process known as a “gibush”, Cohen was one of the few non-[[Sabra (person)|Sabra]] volunteers accepted into the elite ranks of the Israeli Special Forces.<ref name=Brotherhood /> In the mid-1990s, he became a member of the secretive undercover Sayaret (commando) unit known as [[Duvdevan]], ({{lang-he|דובדבן}}; lit. ''cherry'') a counter-terrorist unit that runs missions targeting wanted terrorist suspects in the occupied territories of the West Bank, often while dressed as Palestinian Arabs.<ref>http://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-armys-elite-undercover-unit-in-training-for-a-feared-third-palestinian-intifada/</ref> Aaron Cohen also worked for the [[Mossad]] in their [[covert]] [[Black operation|black operations]] during his time serving in the Israeli Special Forces.
== Post military ==
After his service, Cohen returned to [[Los Angeles]] and launched IMS Security Consultants, Inc., a Hollywood VIP protection service that has done security work for Hollywood actors, VIPs, rock stars and dignitaries.<ref>http://www.cnn.com/2009/SHOWBIZ/Music/11/06/celebrity.security.costs/</ref> IMS Security Consultants recently changed their name to [http://www.cherriesapparel.com/pages/counter-terror-school Cherries Counter-Terror School] and is a leading tactical training firm offering [[Israeli]] [[Special Forces]] style counter-terrorist and “active shooter” training to vetted members of local, State and Federal [[law enforcement]] as well as police [[SWAT]] teams and the U.S. military [[Special Forces]].<ref>http://www.wsfa.com/story/5196017/montgomery-police-departments-swat-team-learns-israeli-tactics?clienttype=printable</ref> Cohen frequently appears as a national security analyst on various major news networks.
After being robbed at gunpoint in her Paris Hotel room, it was rumored that reality star [[:es:Kim_Kardashian|Kim Kardashian]] had hired Cohen, although it has not been confirmed.
== Film and television ==
Cohen has appeared in numerous films including ''[[End of Watch]]'', ''[[Haywire (film)|Haywire]]'' and ''[[Get the Gringo]]''. In ''Haywire'', he was tapped by director [[Steven Soderbergh]] to serve as the film's technical advisor and tactical weapons trainer prepping actors [[Channing Tatum]], [[Gina Carano]] and [[Michael Fassbender]] for their roles as well as consulting on the script.
In 2013 Cohen wrote, directed, and co-starred in the short action war film ''Overwatch'', a war drama about post traumatic stress disorder and the high emotional price paid by American special operations soldiers who carry out dangerous and complex missions. <ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aYEM8FsFhP4</ref>
He is the stepson of the American filmmaker [[Abby Mann]].<ref>http://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/28/movies/28mann2.html?_r=0</ref>
== Book ==
Aaron Cohen’s first book, ''[https://www.amazon.com/Brotherhood-Warriors-Behind-Commando-Counterterrorism/dp/0061236160/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1475902538&sr=8-1&keywords=brotherhood+of+warriors Brotherhood of Warriors: Behind Enemy Lines with a Commando in one of the World’s Most Elite Counterterrorism Units]'', coauthored with journalist and best-selling author [[Douglas Century]], was published by [[Ecco Press]] in April 2008. The book is now available in six languages.
